answers.answer: Metal blowing into the eye will not cause a hole like this. Most of these holes are called "atrophic" and are just due to thinning of the retina of unknown cause perhaps due to vitreous traction.Small pin size holes usually don't cause problem.  Problem are bigger horseshoe shaped tears.JCH MD

question: HiMy eye dr. said I had a pin size hole in the retina.  He said it was probably due to uncontrolled diabetes (which I was recently diagnosed with a year ago) but I feel it was due to a accident where a peice of small microscopic metal blew into my eye.  However further checkups he said the size has not changed.,  However I have floaters quite oftent now. Some months worse than others.  Also just told I have developing cataracts.  Will the hole in the retina ever cause trouble?
title: small hole in retina
